data.title: ''Country Gold With Terri Clark'' Grows to 165 Stations
data.meta_description: RADIO ONLINE offers the latest radio industry news, radio show prep, radio promotions, radio station data and more. RADIO ONLINE has been serving the radio industry since 1989, with up-to-the-minute news at radio-online.com
data.text:
RADIO ONLINE | Monday, July 8, 2019

Westwood One's "Country Gold with Terri Clark" has amassed 165 station affiliates, including WCCQ-FM/Chicago, WKPA-FM/Boston, WDRQ-FM/Detroit, WNKN-FM/Cincinnati, WSM-FM/Nashville, WPUR-FM/Atlantic City-Philadelphia, KTJJ-FM/St. Louis and KXKC-FM/Lafayette. Country Gold is a four-hour music-intensive, fan-interactive program showcasing the biggest Country hits of the 90's, such as music from Martina McBride, Tracy Lawrence, Pam Tillis, Reba McEntire, Colin Raye and Travis Tritt.

"I love hosting Country Gold," said Clark. "It gives me the chance to not only catch up with my peers, but to let fans be a â€˜fly on the wall' and that's what makes this show so special. I'm such a fan of Country music from the 80's and 90's and I'm passionate about keeping that era alive and in the forefront, as well as letting listeners know what their favorite artists are up to today."

Hailing from Medicine Hat, Alberta, Canada, Clark is an eight-time CCMA Entertainer of the Year and she has taken home the Female Vocalist of the Year award five times. She's sold more than four million albums worldwide and has made her mark on radio with 13 top ten singles. Clark also has the honor of being the only Canadian female artist to be a member of the legendary Grand Ole Opry.
